activities:
Currently Tower does not receive personal information from the EU/EEA or Switzerland, but is hoping to grow and is voluntarily submitting to Safe Harbor certification.

If Tower expands its business to include receiving personal data from the EU/EEA, it would likely include receiving employment applications, resumes, email address and phone numbers, and other information related to the staffing effort for people in the EU/EEA.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Off-line, on-line, and manually processed data.
privacyprograms: The BBB EU Safe Harbor Program
recoursemech: The BBB EU Safe Harbor Program
